channel.title: CyberNetSec - Data Breach
channel.description: Latest data breach threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: SK Telecom Profit Plummets 90% Following Massive Data Breach Affecting 27 Million Customers
item.description:
South Korean telecom giant SK Telecom has reported a catastrophic 90% drop in its Q3 operating profit, directly attributing the loss to the massive costs of a data breach that exposed the personal data of 27 million customers. The breach, which went undetected for nearly three years, involved 25 dif...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Hits Swedish Power Grid Operator, Steals 280GB of Data
item.description:
Sweden's national electricity operator, Svenska kraftnät, has confirmed a data breach following a claim by the Everest ransomware group. The attackers alleged on their dark web leak site that they had stolen 280 GB of internal data. Svenska kraftnät stated that the attack was confined to an external...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Penn Data Breach: Hacker Claims 1.2M Donor Records Stolen, Exposes "Terrible Security"
item.description:
A threat actor has claimed responsibility for a massive data breach at the University of Pennsylvania, asserting they have stolen the personal and financial data of 1.2 million donors and alumni. The breach was first revealed after offensive emails were sent from a university system hosted on Salesf...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Polish Government Confirms "Very Serious" Data Breach at SuperGrosz Loan Platform
item.description:
Polish authorities, led by the Deputy Prime Minister, have confirmed a "very serious" data breach at the online loan platform SuperGrosz. The attack resulted in the theft of a vast repository of sensitive customer information, including full names, national identification (PESEL) numbers, ID card de...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

item.title: Akira Ransomware Claims Breach of Apache OpenOffice, Threatens Data Leak
item.description:
The prolific Akira ransomware group has listed Apache OpenOffice, a popular open-source office suite, as a victim on its dark web data leak site. The threat actors claim to have exfiltrated 23 gigabytes of data from the Apache Software Foundation, including financial records, internal documents, and...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Data Breaches Hit Toys 'R' Us Canada, Askul, and Verisure
item.description:
A wave of data breaches has impacted several consumer-facing companies globally. Toys "R" Us Canada has had customer records leaked on the dark web. Japanese retailer Askul suffered a disruptive ransomware attack that halted operations and may have resulted in a data leak. Additionally, Swedish secu...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware

item.title: Conduent Data Breach: 10 Million+ Individuals' Personal & Medical Data Exposed
item.description:
Conduent Business Services, a major contractor for U.S. government agencies, has disclosed a massive data breach impacting over 10 million individuals. The incident, which occurred between October 2024 and January 2025, involved an unauthorized third party gaining access to Conduent's network and ex...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Intelligence, Regulatory

item.title: Ad Giant Dentsu's Subsidiary Merkle Hit by Cyberattack, Staff and Client Data Exposed
item.description:
Global advertising firm Dentsu has confirmed that its US-based customer experience management (CXM) subsidiary, Merkle, was the target of a cyberattack. The company detected 'abnormal activity' on Merkle's network and proactively shut down certain systems to contain the threat. An investigation has ...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Threat Intelligence

item.title: EY Leaks 4TB+ SQL Database Packed with Corporate Secrets via Cloud Misconfiguration
item.description:
Consulting giant EY (Ernst & Young) inadvertently exposed a massive, 4TB+ SQL Server backup file to the public internet due to a cloud storage misconfiguration. The unencrypted `.BAK` file, discovered by researchers at Neo Security, contained a treasure trove of highly sensitive internal data, inclu...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: IncRansom Claims 20TB Data Heist from Evolve Mortgage Services
item.description:
The 'incransom' ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a significant data breach at Evolve Mortgage Services, listing the company on its dark web leak site on October 30, 2025. The attackers allege they have stolen over 20 terabytes of data, including 2 terabytes of databases containing sen...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor
